expl: the stopping point of each round was signaled by a bell
the market was up at the finish
they were playing better at the close of the season
stopping_point.n.01.defn: the temporal end; the concluding time

expl: he was the last to leave
he finished an inglorious last
last.n.02.defn: the last or lowest in an ordering or series

expl: he breathed his last
last.n.03.defn: a person's dying act; the final thing a person can do

expl: she stayed until his death
a struggle to the last
death.n.05.defn: the time at which life ends; continuing until dead

last.n.05.defn: a unit of weight equal to 4,000 pounds

last.n.06.defn: a unit of capacity for grain equal to 80 bushels

expl: the end was exciting
I had to miss the last of the movie
end.n.03.defn: the concluding parts of an event or occurrence

last.n.08.defn: holding device shaped like a human foot that is used to fashion or repair shoes

expl: there is a special cleaner for these surfaces
the cloth had a pattern of red dots on a white surface
surface.n.01.defn: the outer boundary of an artifact or a material layer constituting or resembling such a boundary

expl: they skimmed over the surface of the water
a brush small enough to clean every dental surface
the sun has no distinct surface
surface.n.02.defn: the extended two-dimensional outer boundary of a three-dimensional object

expl: earthquakes originate far below the surface
three quarters of the Earth's surface is covered by water
surface.n.03.defn: the outermost level of the land or sea

expl: it was not what it appeared to be on the surface
surface.n.04.defn: a superficial aspect as opposed to the real nature of something

expl: all the reports were out in the open
the facts had been brought to the surface

airfoil.n.01.defn: a device that provides reactive force when in motion relative to the surrounding air; can lift or control a plane in flight

expl: replacing the star will not be easy
replacement.n.01.defn: the act of furnishing an equivalent person or thing in the place of another

surrogate.n.01.defn: someone who takes the place of another person

expl: the replacement of lost blood by a transfusion of donor blood
substitution.n.01.defn: an event in which one thing is substituted for another

substitute.n.01.defn: a person or thing that takes or can take the place of another

refilling.n.01.defn: filling again by supplying what has been used up

expl: he was President Lincoln's successor
successor.n.01.defn: a person who follows next in order
